title: Richmond headlines area top 10 poll
text:
Richmond headlines area top 10 poll Matt Sheehan, Times Herald 5:39 p.m. EDT October 19, 2015 Richmond players take the field during a football game Friday, October 16, 2015 at Richmond High School. (Photo: Jeffrey M Smith/Times Herald) 1 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Algonac’s three week reign of being the area’s No. 1 team has come to a close in dramatic fashion. 
Richmond (7-1), our new No. 1-ranked area football team, topped the No. 2-ranked Muskrats (7-1) last Friday in a must-win home game, 15-14. If the Blue Devils lost, the Blue Water Area Conference title would’ve been solely given to Algonac. Since Richmond pulled out the victory, both Algonac and Richmond share the title along with the top two spots in our rankings. Richmond holds off Algonac, 15-14 
Sandusky (8-0), once again, annihilated their GTC East opponent to remain undefeated. The Redskins latest victim was Memphis (1-7), topping the Yellowjackets 54-12. The gritty Sandusky defense still has yet to let up 100 total points this season, giving up an average of just 11.75 points per game. 
Croswell-Lexington (6-2) stays at No. 4 after a thrilling 28-27 win over Almont (7-1) to not only clinch its first playoff spot in three years, but also keep the Raiders from sharing the BWAC title. 
Marine City (5-3) and Marysville (6-2) are still ranked No. 5 and No. 6, respectively. Marine City’s Sept. 11 win over Marysville still gives the Mariners the slight edge over the Vikings despite Marysville’s five-game win streak since that game. Ellul, Kiger talk about MAC Gold title 
Port Huron (2-6) and Port Huron Northern (4-4) each lost on Friday and have swapped poll positions from last week. The Big Reds are ranked No. 7 while the Huskies are No. 8 before this Friday’s can’t-miss crosstown rivalry game at Memorial Stadium. 
After losing three games in a row, Yale has responded by winning its last two with a combined score of 96-6. The Bulldogs latest victim was Imlay City, who took a 46-6 defeat to Yale, and they’ll try to end their season on an exclamation point against North Branch on Friday. 
Rounding out our top ten is St. Clair (3-5), who fell to Marysville to officially be eliminated from playoff contention, snapping a three-year playoff streak. 
Top 10 Poll
